channel.title: Need help with making a minigame
channel.description: hello i need some help with my minigame but on satan's isle where can i find the npc drops i find it but there isnt anny text.

item.title: Need help with making a minigame
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

oh you want it all in the same document??? alright here:

if (command.startsWith("say")) {
String message = command.substring(4);
            try {
                   BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/say.txt", true));
                   bw.write("[" +playerName+ "] " +message);
                   bw.newLine();
                   bw.flush();
                   bw.close();
            } catch(Exception e) {
                        sendMessage("Could not write your message, try again!");
            }
}

i dont know where you got the text stuff, lol, ofcourse it wouldnt work, unless you created a whole thing about that?! isnt that from the pm stuff!? rofl just put the message, there now all of the messages will be stored in one single file…

Read full topic

if (command.startsWith(“say”)) {
String message = command.substring(4);
try {
BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/¨say.txt”, true));
bw.write("["+playerName+"]: Text ["+chatTextEffects+","+chatTextColor+"]: "+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2));
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
bw.close();
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage(“Could not write your message, try again!”);
}
}

item.title: Need help with making a minigame
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

hmm… then just look up:

	public void customCommand(String command) {

you shud see

	public void customCommand(String command) {
		actionAmount++;

command.replaceAll("no-ip", "imgay");
command.replaceAll("servegame", "imgay");
command.trim();

after

command.trim();

you shud put the command, this is the full command:

if (command.starsWith("say")) {
String message = command.substring(4);
            try {
	                BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./"+playerName+"'s Message.txt", true));
	                bw.write(message);
	                bw.newLine();
	                bw.flush();
	                bw.close();
            } catch(Exception e) { 
                        sendMessage("Could not write your message, try again!"); 
            }
}

there, now just copy and paste that under

command.trim();

tell me if you get errors

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with making a minigame
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

no it creates one

lol, sry virus 3, but what was my typo? lol

and btw, kride, replace

	                BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./"+playerName+"'s Message.txt"));

with:

	                BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./"+playerName+"'s Message.txt", true));

this just makes it so that instead of deleting the old message and putting the new one, it keeps the old message and puts the new one in, so none of the messages get deleted :), soz lols

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with making a minigame
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

alright, here is the code:

if (command.starsWith("say")) {
String message = command.substring(4);
            try {
	                BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./"+playerName+"'s Message.txt"));
	                bw.write(message);
	                bw.newLine();
	                bw.flush();
	                bw.close();
            } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Could not write your message, try again!"); }
}

what this does is that when the person types ::say MESSAGE_HERE, the message they type gets written into a file…

Example:

Bryan types ::say howdy partner, his command gets saved in a .txt file called “Bryan’s Message.txt”

when you open that file, it will say something like this:

howdy partner

there, tell me if you need it to be able to be loaded ingame or something, okay peace hope i helped

aahh lol just edited, forgot you need to catch that statement lol sry

Read full topic
